str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
